meeting_annotations.speaker: Arnold Hayer, McGill
meeting_annotations.transcript: Hi everyone, I wanted to give a quick update on the project that I'm working on. So, I've been looking at the effect of different types of mutations on protein folding. And I found that some mutations can cause proteins to misfold, which can lead to disease. I'm currently working on a paper that describes these findings. I'm hoping to submit it to a journal in the next few weeks. I'm also planning to present these findings at a conference in the fall. I'm really excited about this project, and I think it has the potential to make a significant contribution to our understanding of protein folding and disease.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Joyoni Dey, LSU, Physics
meeting_annotations.transcript: Hi, I'm Joyoni Dey from LSU, Physics. I'm working on a project that is related to the study of the properties of materials at the atomic level. I'm using computational methods to simulate the behavior of atoms and molecules in different materials. I'm hoping to use this information to design new materials with desired properties.
